description.narrative: Strategic Results Partnerships, and Innovation for accelerating delivery of top quality programmatic results for the SDGs and organizational efficiency and effectiveness for program delivery

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Program board meetings 1.2. CO Annual Business Plan development 1.3 Approval status of Annual Work Plan 1.4 Revision of AWP tracking 1.5 CPD and SP alignment 2.1 Updates on Project quality assurance 2.2 Projects to be closed 2.3 Review Programme SOPs 2.4 Implementation of capacity building plans 2.5. Risk Logs 2.6 Issue Logs 3.1 Evaluation plan and management response implementation 3.2 Status of M&E Annual plan 3.3 Indicator methodological sheets 3.4 Monitoring visits 3.5 IWP progress updated as per result tracker 3.6 Conduct review meetings 4.1 Result Oriented Annual Reporting 4.2 CO Annual Report 4.3 Approved Annual Progress Report submitted 4.4 Review semiannual report submitted by projects 4.5 Updated ATLAS project mg module along with results and finalize IATI 4.6 Update donor report tracking tool

comment.narrative:
1. Strategic planning and programming for delivery of results (PLANNING) strengthened 1.1. By the end of each quarter in 2020 , all projects Atlas Mgt Module are updated 1.2. By the end of 2020, all the CPD outcomes and outputs annual milestones are updated 1.3. By the end of first quarter all steps of Annual buisness plan 2020 is completed and endorsed . 2: Quality of Country Programme and projects strengthened to support in high performance and programme delivery (QUALITY ASSURANCE) 2.1. By the end of 2020 Q2, all new, implemnetation and closure QA are updated in the system 2.2. By the end of 2020 quarter 2, Standard Operational Procedures for program planning, QA and reporting in line new CPD 2018-2022 updated. All relevant staffs trained and ensure effective implementation 2.3. By the end of each quarter in 2020 all KPI indicators for planning, M&E, Reporting are tracked and monitored
3: Strengthen Integrated Programme through strong Monitoring & Evaluation system/RBM support (MONITORING, EVALUATION, AUDIT) 3.1. By the end of 2020 Quarter 2, M&E plans are reviewed, finalized and approved with clear indicators, source and capacities in place for implementation. Monthly discussion and review organized with projects led by programme team 3.2. By the end of every Quarter of 2020, Evaluation Plan is tracked and management response of evaluations monitored 3.3. By the end of 2020 quarter 3, a tracking system and tools in place for key result monitoring 3.4. By the end of 2020, key M&E focal points are trained in basic M&E system 3.5. By the end of 2020, ensure that all new projects formulated are of Gen 2 and have specific reporting on gender indicators.
4: Strengthen evidence based performance reporting and ensure compliance with corporate and donor reporting requirements (REPORTING) 4.1. By the end of 2020, all projects are reporting APRs, QPRs and BTORs as per corporate and Co standards. 4.2. By the end of 2020, ensure that all projects report to donor as per reporting calendar
5: Establish new partnerships for programme implementation and resource mobilisation 5.1. CO resource mobilisation target achieved 5.2. By end 2020, 1-2 triple win partnerships with private sector secured
6: Identify innovations and support projects and programme teams to integrate organizational knowledge and innovation approaches into their work 6.1. By end 2020, 2-3 projects effectively use innovative data collection and analytical tools for monitoring and adaptive management 6.2. A public-sector innovation lab to identify new ways of addressing development challenges established with private sector support 6.3. By end 2020, 1-2 flagship innovative development solutions successfully implemented
7: Deliver country office visibility and effective internal and external communications at all levels 7.1. UNDP programme areas/activities gain media traction and start to have brand recognition 7.2. Volume to UNDP website and blogs increases by 25% 7.3. UNDP changes the way we communicate (3-5 criteria for strategic communications fulfilled)

Volume to UNDP website and blogs increases by 25% 7.3. UNDP changes the way we communicate (3-5 criteria for strategic communications fulfilled)

1: Strategic planning and programming for delivery of results (PLANNING) strengthened 1.1. In 2019, atlas project management training was conducted 4 times for the existing and newly joined programme staff and support the projects to update the atlas project. The status of the projects is updated in the regular Programme Management Meeting for necessary action 1.2. By the end of 2019 quarter 1, all the CPD outcomes and outputs annual milestones are updated 1.3. 2019 Annual business plan 2019 is completed and endorsed according to the set timeline
2: Quality of Country Programme and projects strengthened to support in high performance and programme delivery (QUALITY ASSURANCE) 2.1. By the end of 2019 Q2, all new and closure QA are updated in the system 2.2. Newly joined program staff are trained on QA to enhance their capacity to conduct QA for the projects under their respective programme. By the end of 2019 quarter 2, Standard Operational Procedures for program planning, QA and reporting in line new CPD 2018-2022 updated. All relevant staffs trained and ensure effective implementation 2.3. KPI indicators for planning, M&E, Reporting are tracked and discussed at the Management Integrated team meeting.
3: Strengthen Integrated Programme through strong Monitoring & Evaluation system/RBM support (MONITORING, EVALUATION, AUDIT) 3.1. Integrated project M&E plans are reviewed, finalized and approved with clear indicators, source and capacities in place for implementation. Monthly discussion and review organized with projects led by programme team 3.2. Three evaluations have been conducted and CO Evaluation Plan is tracked and management response of evaluations monitored regularly 3.3. Result indicators are tracked and monitored and visualized by using Sapphire data base system and power Bi and shared at the project board meetings, donor meeting and reports 3.4. RBM Technical Working Group is formed with each RBM points from project and meet monthly to discuss and update on the M& E system. 3.5. Project indicators have been reviewed and revised to ensure gender responsive and ensure that all new projects formulated are of Gen 2 and have specific reporting on gender indicator
4: Strengthen evidence based performance reporting and ensure compliance with corporate and donor reporting requirements (REPORTING) 4.1. All projects are reporting APRs, QPRs and BTORs as per corporate and CO standards. 4.2. All projects report to donor as per reporting calendar
5.1 Partnership and communication action plan drafted but not yet finalized. More than 80% of action points are implemented in terms of Communication action plan. 5.2. One partnership with private sector – Ooredoo and one partnership with individual donor was secured.
6.1 An app-based Online Case Information System for the Supreme Court was piloted as innovative data collection and analysis tool, which can solve a critical information gap by providing real-time information on court cases filed in the lower courts, and also the ability to quickly query the data. 6.2. Digital Innovation and Entrepreneurship Hub launch in October as joint Ooredoo-UNDP partnership initiative. The Hackathon is a special initiative of the UNDP and Ooredoo to promote and scale up digital innovation and entrepreneurship amongst the youth in Myanmar. UN agencies (WFP, UNOPS, FAO) supported the event as judges, facilitators and mentors. 7: Deliver country office visibility and effective internal and external communications at all levels For Twitter, 190 Tweets have been posted and 752 mention, 9 k new followers, 22k profile visit and 6 Million tweet impression Facebook 1.7 Million followers and likes You tube 115 subscribers, with 4.7 K views with 321 /K impressions For website, user 50 k with 139k reviews

1.1. Number of projects quarterly updated on the Atlas Mgt Module (target: all) 1.2. Number of CPD outcomes and outputs annual milestones updated by end 2021 (target: all) 1.3. Number of steps of Annual business plan 2021 completed and endorsed by end Q1 (target: all) 2.1 Keep track of 10+10 COBP indicators and update quarterly to ensure the high performance of CO 9 (target: all ) 2.2 Number of new Design, implementation and closure QA are updated in the system by end Q4 (target: all) 3.1. By the end of 2021 Quarter 2, M&E plans are reviewed, finalized and approved with clear indicators, source and capacities in place for implementation. 3.2. By the end of every Quarter of 2021, Evaluation Plan is tracked and management response of evaluations monitored 3.3. Number of projects applying Power BI for monitoring purposes (Baseline: 1, Target: 6) 3.4. By the end of 2021 quarter 3, a tracking system and tools in place for key result monitoring (target: 1) 4.1. Number of projects reporting APRs, QPRs and BTORs as per corporate and CO standards (target: all) 4.2. Number of projects report to donor as per reporting calendar (target: all) 5.1. Relevant, cross functional and CO-wide management priorities are met (target: all) 6.1. Number of comprehensive, CO wide, programme risk management framework in place. (Baseline: 0, Target: 1) 6.2. Development projects keep track of the risk and updated the management and status regularly. (target all) 7.1. Number of new private sector partnerships forged to support the acceleration of the CPD (Baseline: 0, Target: 2) 10.1. Number of UNDP programme areas/activities gain media traction and start to have brand recognition (target: 1-3 10.2. Volume to UNDP website and blogs increased. (target: 25%) 10.3. UNDP changed the way we communicate (target: 3-5 criteria for strategic communications fulfilled)

Following the military takeover power in Feb 2021, all the existing programme has been reviewed and aligned with the UN engagement Principle that is accrue to the benefit of the community. AWPs have been reviewed and revised accordingly and QAed and recorded.
